data.event: Selma was settled in 1847 by immigrants from various countries.

event.title: 1849, the Harrison and Brown stagecoach stop was built

data.event: In 1849, the Harrison and Brown stagecoach stop was built in Selma to handle passengers and freight on the San Antonio to Austin stagecoach line.
John Harrison and his wife Martha moved to Selma in 1852, and he became the first postmaster of the town when the post office opened in 1856.

data.event: By 1885, the population was 145, and at the turn of the century, the population peaked at 600.

event.title: began a quick decline, so much that by 1906

data.event: The population began a quick decline, so much that by 1906 the post office was closed.
The city incorporated in 1964 and has seen tremendous growth along the Interstate 35 corridor since 2000.
